intro: Cephaelis coriacea, commonly known as the roughleaf cephaelis, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its rough, hairy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique appearance and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
